metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3636 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ping_unhash function in net/ipv4/ping.c in the Linux kernel before4.0.3 does not initialize a certain list data structure during an unhashoperation, which allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial ofservice (use-after-free and system crash) by leveraging the ability to makea SOCK_DGRAM socket system call for the IPPROTO_ICMP or IPPROTO_ICMPV6protocol, and then making a connect system call after a disconnect.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
